message.content:
cs.DC, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category as it proposes a new scheduling framework for ML training workloads on a shared cluster of GPUs. It also discusses the limitations of existing cluster scheduling disciplines and proposes a new notion of finish-time fairness. 

It is also likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories as it deals with ML workloads and proposes a new scheduling framework to improve their efficiency and fairness. 

The System and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper discusses the use of a central arbiter to run an auction for available resources. 

Finally, the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category is a possibility as the paper deals with ML training workloads that use GPUs, which are commonly used in neural network training.
